intro: Mollinedia chrysorrachis var. polytricha, commonly known as the golden threadleaf, is a rare and striking member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, golden-yellow leaves that give it a delicate, fern-like appearance. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Native to the high-altitude regions of South America, it thrives in cool, moist environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species requiring conservation efforts.
